intro: Maclurochloa locbacensis, commonly known as the Locbacensis grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, particularly in Vietnam and Laos. This plant is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
